moves.1. c4 f5 2. g4: !? -- The Krejcik Gambit, played off of 1. c4, a pet line of mine.
moves.2... fxg4: Played after some hesitation. Might be the first time my opponent had seen 2. g4!?
moves.3. h3 gxh3 4. Nxh3 Nf6 5. Nc3 d6: Black is being overly cautious already. Time-tested chess rules of thumb: 1) the only way to refute a gambit is to accept it; 2) refutation demands vigorous play. Bolder is 5. ...d5.
moves.6. Bg2 c6 7. d4 e6 8. e4: So now White has better development AND more space for his pawn.
moves.8... Be7 9. Nf4 O-O 10. Qe2 Qc7 11. d5 e: ?? Goodnight, Irene. That move beckons mate-in-3.
